data.title: AESTRA: Radial velocity measurements in the presence of stellar activity noise
data.name: aestra
data.description: AESTRA (Auto-Encoding STellar Radial-velocity and Activity) is a deep learning method for precise radial velocity measurements in the presence of stellar activity noise.

evidence: "AESTRA (Auto-Encoding STellar Radial-velocity and Activity) is a deep learning method for precise radial velocity measurements in the presence of stellar activity noise."
"The input consists of a collection of hundreds or more of spectra of a single star, which span a variety of activity states and orbital motion phases of any potential planets."
The project is presented as a research method/architecture in a GitHub repository with no mention of packaging or registries, implying use via cloning the source repository.
